s0001: Zhang Yi was a native of Wei.
s0002: In his youth, he studied alongside Su Qin under Master Guigu, learning the arts of persuasion. Su Qin always considered himself inferior to Zhang Yi.
s0003: Once Zhang Yi had mastered diplomatic persuasion, he traveled among the feudal lords.
s0004: He once drank with the Prime Minister of Chu. Later, the prime minister discovered his precious jade disc was missing. His attendants suspected Zhang Yi, saying, 'Zhang Yi is poor and of questionable character—he must have stolen the prime minister's jade disc.'
s0005: They seized Zhang Yi and beat him several hundred lashes. He refused to confess, so they branded him.
s0007: If you hadn't studied and traveled as a persuader, how would you have come to this humiliation?'
s0008: Zhang Yi asked his wife, 'Is my tongue still there?'
s0009: His wife laughed and said, 'It's still there.'
s0012: After Su Qin had persuaded the King of Zhao and secured alliances with neighboring states, he worried that Qin might attack the other lords and break the alliances. Thinking of who might be useful in Qin, he secretly sent someone to tempt Zhang Yi: 'You were once close to Su Qin. Now Qin holds power—why not go there to seek your fortune?'
s0013: Zhang Yi then went to Zhao and requested an audience with Su Qin.
s0014: Su Qin ordered his attendants not to let him in, and kept him waiting for several days.
s0015: Finally, when he received him, he seated Zhang Yi in the main hall below the platform and served him the food given to servants and concubines.
s0016: Then he repeatedly rebuked him: 'With your talents and abilities, you've brought yourself to this state of destitution and humiliation.
s0017: I could speak on your behalf and make you wealthy and honored, but you're not worth saving.'
s0019: Zhang Yi had come expecting to be treated as an old friend and receive assistance. Instead he was humiliated. Angry, he realized no other lord would take him in—only Qin could challenge Zhao. So he went to Qin.
s0020: Later, Su Qin told his attendants: 'Zhang Yi is the most talented man in the world. I am no match for him.

s0025: He spoke to the King of Zhao, who provided gold, coins, chariots, and horses. Su Qin sent people to secretly follow Zhang Yi, share his lodging, gradually get close to him, and provide him with chariots, horses, gold, and money—whatever he needed, without telling him who was behind it.
s0026: Thus Zhang Yi was able to meet King Hui of Qin.
s0027: King Hui appointed him as a guest minister and consulted with him on attacking the feudal lords.
